DataElement.preferredDefinition: an indicator related to measurable disease being present.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to measurable disease being present.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Capable of being measured.:A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: Present; the period of time that is happening now.

Concepts.definition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: an indicator for presence of measurable disease.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Non-Measurable; not possible to be measured.
The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.origin: GOG CRF:Gynecologic Oncology Group Case Report Form

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has measurable disease, defined as at least one lesion that can be accurately measured in at least one dimension (longest diameter to be recorded) as >=20 mm with conventional techniques or as >=10 mm with spiral CT scan?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the patient have measura
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have measurable disease defined as any tumor lesion that can be accurately measured in at least one dimension with a minimum size of 1.0 cm by CT scan (CT scan slice thickness < 0.5 cm), 1.0 cm caliper measurement by clinical exam, 2.0 cm by chest X-ray, or 1.5 cm malignant, pathologically enlarged lymph node by CT scan?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the enhancing tumor have a maximal diameter of 5 cm?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have measurable disease at baseline, defined as at least one lesion that can be accurately measured in at least one dimension (longest  diameter to be recorded) as >20mm with conventional techniques or as >10mm with spiral CT scan?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have measurable disease defined as at least one lesion that can be accurately measured in at least one dimension (longest diameter to be recorded) as >2 cm with conventional techniques or as > 1cm with spiral CT scan?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF TEXT 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the tumor >50mm in any dimension

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the tumor >1cm and amendable to injection by endoscopy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the tumor amenable to intratumoral injection with at least 1ml of OBP-301?

ReferenceDocuments.name: AMC Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: If Yes, does the participant have measurable disease with a minimum of five bi-dimensionally measurable KS cutaneous marker lesions OR, if fewer than five bi-dimensionally measurable marker lesions are available, the total surface area of the marker lesion(s) is ≥ 700mm²?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is there at least 1cm by 1cm of contrast-enhancing tumor that is no greater than 4cm in largest dimension?

DataElement.origin: GOG CRF:Gynecologic Oncology Group Case Report Form
